TEI.2.document_title: Thomas G Western and Others to Stephen F Austin, 08-25-1832

barker_notes.barker_summary: Thomas G. Western et al. to Austin, Goliad, August 23, 1832. Military commandant refuses to declare for Sata Anna, but civil authorities are ready to do so.

*div1 type="summary"* *p*Thomas G. Western et al. to Austin, Goliad, August 23, 1832. Military commandant refuses to declare for Sata Anna, but civil authorities are ready to do so.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Goliad*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="08-25-1832">August 25—1832*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Sir*/p*
*p*In addition to our representation under *date_mentioned n="08-24-1832">yesterdays date*/date_mentioned* handed to you here with, we have further to lay before you the following facts,—*/p*
*p*The *person_mentioned*Military commandant of *location_mentioned*this post*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* continues obstinately to oppose the Plan of *person_mentioned*Genl. Sta Anna*/person_mentioned*, after the receipt of the pronouncement of your *person_mentioned*Ayuntamiento */person_mentioned*(by the *person_mentioned*Authorities */person_mentioned*here) he was called upon by them to attend a meeting of their *person_mentioned*Corporate body*/person_mentioned* to deliberate upon the reply to be made, he refused, alledging that himself and his *person_mentioned*officers */person_mentioned*would continue to adhere to the actual Govmt. of *person_mentioned*Sr Bustamte*/person_mentioned* untill compelled by force of arms to act otherwise.—*/p*
*p*After closing *date_mentioned n="08-23-1832">last evening*/date_mentioned* our respects before alluded to, the mail arrived from your *location_mentioned*quarter*/location_mentioned*— it brought dispatches to the *person_mentioned*Commandant */person_mentioned*and this morning he waited upon the *person_mentioned*Alcalde*/person_mentioned*, shewing him a confidential letter he had received, stating that *person_mentioned*Mr. Bowie*/person_mentioned* was now on his march to *location_mentioned*Bejar*/location_mentioned*, with *person_mentioned*troops*/person_mentioned*,—that a force had been prepared with you to come to *location_mentioned*this place*/location_mentioned*, but that it had not come hither in consequence of your having been informed that this place had already pronounced in favor of the Constitution and Laws—He demanded of the *person_mentioned*Alcalde */person_mentioned*his aid, of the *person_mentioned*Civicos */person_mentioned*etc. in case this *person_mentioned*force */person_mentioned*should come, the *person_mentioned*Alcalde */person_mentioned*told him not to expect from him any aid whatever, that neither he nor the *person_mentioned*Citizens */person_mentioned*would oppose the forces of *person_mentioned*Santa Anna*/person_mentioned*, and that should they come, he might get within his own walls and make what defense he could with his *person_mentioned*troops*/person_mentioned*—he then said he would communicate with him on the Subject and make his demand officially—to which the *person_mentioned*Alcalde */person_mentioned*replied, that he should make him the same answer in writing, that he then did verbally— finally the *person_mentioned*Commdt*/person_mentioned*. manifested, that should he find no assistance here, he would proceed with his *person_mentioned*troops */person_mentioned*to *location_mentioned*Bejar*/location_mentioned*, and join those of his own *person_mentioned*party */person_mentioned*there,—these are the last occurences transpired here up to this hour 4 P. M.—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*J. Antonio Vasquez [Rubric] Secrtio. de Ayunto.*/person_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Thomas, G, Western */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p* *p**person_mentioned*Jno. Hallet */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p* *p**person_mentioned*J W. H. Living */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p*To *person_mentioned*Col. S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned**location_mentioned* San Felipe*/location_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
